alert.note: Alert for Adams (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 6:44AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR BIG DRY CREEK FROM THORNTON NORTHEAST TO FORT LUPTON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including Big Dry Creek from the Thornton and Westminster area downstream to the confluence with the South Platte River near Fort Lupton. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 AM MDT, Flooding was occurring on 144th avenue between Washington and York Street. Stream levels were still rising downstream to Brighton. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lowland areas along Big Dry Creek from the Thornton and Westminster area downstream to the confluence with the South Platte River near Fort Lupton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
